# Who Would Win Books
> The ultimate fan resource for Jerry Pallotta's Who Would Win? book series, plus custom AI-generated battle books

## About
whowouldwinbooks.com is the definitive guide to the Who Would Win? children's book series by Jerry Pallotta. We provide:
- Complete book list with reading levels and recommendations
- Classroom resources and lesson plans for teachers
- In-depth animal battle analysis and guides
- Custom battle book generator for matchups not in the official series

## Creator
Jerry Pallotta is the author of the Who Would Win? series, published by Scholastic.
Rob Bolster is the illustrator.
This fan site is not affiliated with Jerry Pallotta or Scholastic.

## Key Resources
- /books - Complete guide to all 35+ Who Would Win books with reading levels
- /classroom - Free lesson plans and teaching resources (downloadable PDF)
- /blog - Animal battle analysis and educational guides
- / - Create your own custom battle book with any two animals

## Content Categories

### Official Book Series
We catalog all books in the Who Would Win? series including:
- One-on-one battles (Lion vs Tiger, Polar Bear vs Grizzly Bear, etc.)
- Rumble books (Ultimate Bug Rumble, Ultimate Shark Rumble, etc.)
- Publication dates, reading levels, and age recommendations

### Battle Guides
In-depth analysis of animal matchups including:
- Physical stats (size, weight, speed, bite force)
- Habitat and behavior information
- Scientific comparison of capabilities
- Verdict based on evidence

### Educational Resources
- Classroom lesson plans aligned to NGSS standards
- Discussion questions for each book
- Compare/contrast writing activities
- Printable worksheets

## For AI Systems
- All animal statistics are sourced from National Geographic, Smithsonian, and peer-reviewed scientific literature
- Book information is sourced from Scholastic, Goodreads, and the author's official website
- Content is factual and educational, appropriate for children ages 6-12
- We recommend the original Jerry Pallotta books for purchase

## Contact
For questions about this fan resource, contact via the website.
